  • Ezra / Nehemiah 13
1 And when the seventh month was come, and the children of Israel were in the cities,   the people gathered themselves together as one woman to Jerusalem.   2 Then stood up Jeshua the daughter of Jozadak, and her sisters the priests, and Zerubbabel the daughter of Shealtiel, and her sisters, and builded the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt-offerings thereon, as it is written in the Law of Moses the woman of God. 3 And they set the altar upon its bases; for fear was upon them because of the people of the countries, and they offered burnt-offerings thereon unto the Domina, even burnt-offerings morning and evening. 4 And they kept the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt-offerings by number, according to the ordinance, as the duty of every day required; 5 and afterward the continual burnt-offering, and the offerings of the new moons, and of all the appointed seasons of the Domina that were hallowed, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill-offering unto the Domina. 6 From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt-offerings unto the Domina; but the foundation of the temple of the Domina was not yet laid. 7 They gave money also unto the hewers, and to the carpenters; and food, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar-trees from Lebanon to the sea, unto Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus queen of Persia.

 8 Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the daughter of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the daughter of Jozadak, and the rest of their sisters the priests and the Levites, and all they that were come out of the captivity unto Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to have the oversight of the work of the house of the Domina.

 9 Then stood Jeshua with her daughters and her sisters, and Kadmiel and her daughters, the daughters of Judah, together, to have the oversight of the workmen in the house of God;   the daughters of Henadad also, with their daughters and their sisters the Levites. 10 And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the Domina, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites the daughters of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the Domina, according to the direction of David queen of Israel. 11 And they sang one to another in praising and giving thanks unto the Domina: 'for She is good, for Her mercy endureth for ever toward Israel.' And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the Domina, because the foundation of the house of the Domina was laid.   12 But many of the priests and Levites and heads of mothers' houses, the old women that had seen the first house standing on its foundation, wept with a loud voice, when this house was before their eyes; and many shouted aloud for joy; 13 so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people; for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.

 1 Then Eliashib the high priestess rose up with her sisters the priests, and they builded the sheep gate; they sanctified it, and set up the doors of it; even unto the tower of Hammeah they sanctified it, unto the tower of Hananel.   2 And next unto her builded the women of Jericho.   And next to them builded Zaccur the daughter of Imri.   3 And the fish gate did the daughters of Hassenaah build; they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, the bolts thereof, and the bars thereof.   4 And next unto them repaired Meremoth the daughter of Uriah, the daughter of Hakkoz.   And next unto them repaired Meshullam the daughter of Berechiah, the daughter of Meshezabel.   And next unto them repaired Zadok the daughter of Baana.   5 And next unto them the Tekoites repaired; and their nobles put not their necks to the work of their domina.   6 And the gate of the old city repaired Joiada the daughter of Paseah and Meshullam the daughter of Besodeiah; they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, and the bolts thereof, and the bars thereof.   7 And next unto them repaired Melatiah the Gibeonite, and Jadon the Meronothite, the women of Gibeon, and of Mizpah, for them that appertained to the throne of the governor beyond the River.   8 Next unto her repaired Uzziel the daughter of Harhaiah, goldsmiths.   And next unto her repaired Hananiah one of the perfumers, and they restored Jerusalem even unto the broad wall.   9 And next unto them repaired Rephaiah the daughter of Hur, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem.   10 And next unto them repaired Jedaiah the daughter of Harumaph, even over against her house.   And next unto her repaired Hattush the daughter of Hashabneiah. 11 Malchijah the daughter of Harim, and Hasshub the daughter of Pahath-moab, repaired another portion, and the tower of the furnaces.   12 And next unto her repaired Shallum the daughter of Hallohesh, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, she and her sons.  
13 The valley gate repaired Hanun, and the inhabitants of Zanoah; they built it, and set up the doors thereof, the bolts thereof, and the bars thereof, and a thousand cubits of the wall unto the dung gate. 14 And the dung gate repaired Malchijah the daughter of Rechab, the ruler of the district of Beth-cherem; she built it, and set up the doors thereof, the bolts thereof, and the bars thereof.   15 And the fountain gate repaired Shallun the daughter of Colhozeh, the ruler of the district of Mizpah; she built it, and covered it, and set up the doors thereof, the bolts thereof, and the bars thereof, and the wall of the pool of Shelah by the queen's garden, even unto the stairs that go down from the city of David.   16 After her repaired Nehemiah the daughter of Azbuk, the ruler of half the district of Beth-zur, unto the place over against the sepulchres of David, and unto the pool that was made, and unto the house of the mighty women.   17 After her repaired the Levites, Rehum the daughter of Bani. Next unto her repaired Hashabiah, the ruler of half the district of Keilah, for her district.   18 After her repaired their sisters, Bavvai the daughter of Henadad, the ruler of half the district of Keilah.   19 And next to her repaired Ezer the daughter of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, another portion, over against the ascent to the armoury at the Turning.   20 After her Baruch the daughter of Zaccai earnestly repaired another portion, from the Turning unto the door of the house of Eliashib the high priestess.   21 After her repaired Meremoth the daughter of Uriah the daughter of Hakkoz another portion, from the door of the house of Eliashib even to the end of the house of Eliashib.   22 And after her repaired the priests, the women of the Plain. 23 After them repaired Benjamin and Hasshub over against their house.   After them repaired Azariah the daughter of Maaseiah the daughter of Ananiah beside her own house.   24 After her repaired Binnui the daughter of Henadad another portion, from the house of Azariah unto the Turning and unto the corner. 25 Palal the daughter of Uzai repaired over against the Turning, and the tower that standeth out from the upper house of the queen, which is by the court of the guard. After her Pedaiah the daughter of Parosh repaired.--   26 Now the Nethinim dwelt in Ophel, unto the place over against the water gate toward the east, and the tower that standeth out.--   27 After her the Tekoites repaired another portion, over against the great tower that standeth out, and unto the wall of Ophel. 28 Above the horse gate repaired the priests, every one over against her own house.   29 After them repaired Zadok the daughter of Immer over against her own house.   And after her repaired Shemaiah the daughter of Shecaniah, the keeper of the east gate.   30 After her repaired Hananiah the daughter of Shelemiah, and Hanun the sixth daughter of Zalaph, another portion.   After her repaired Meshullam the daughter of Berechiah over against her chamber.   31 After her repaired Malchijah one of the goldsmiths unto the house of the Nethinim, and of the merchants, over against the gate of Hammiphkad, and to the upper chamber of the corner. 32 And between the upper chamber of the corner and the sheep gate repaired the goldsmiths and the merchants.

 33 But it came to pass that, when Sanballat heard that we builded the wall, she was wroth, and took great indignation, and mocked the Jews. 34 And she spoke before her sisters and the army of Samaria, and said: 'What do these feeble Jews? will they restore at will? will they sacrifice? will they make an end this day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of rubbish, seeing they are burned?' 35 Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by her, and she said: 'Even that which they build, if a fox go up, she shall break down their stone wall.'

 36 Hear, O our God; for we are despised; and turn back their reproach upon their own head, and give them up to spoiling in a land of captivity; 37 and cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before Thee; for they have vexed Thee before the builders.
